transcribed, English 213, Dr. Mike Chasar, Willamette University

body.p: I have just returned from meeting at the Red School House it is very warm and I have picked me out a good cool place to write you and John each a letter to inform you folks that I am still in the land of the living
Walter I received your letter dated the 11th about the 14th and was very glad to here hear from you

you say you want all the little particulars there is no particulars here it is a rough new backward contery country the folks are a rough hardworking ignorant set of fellows but goodharted goodhearted
I am still driving team and I like it very well we have good roads all the way planked and I drive the best team on the road Tim & Cub they are Extra
I do not know how long I shal shall stay here I shal shall stay here till until I get good and ready to leve leave

Walt the 4th July I shal shall
rushit rush it some I have the best buggy and Harness there is in Scio with my horses wich will make a very fine turnout

we are all going to Bellfast it is about 20 miles from the gangmills where I work since I have been here we have had one show wich which was very poor but the folks liked it very much one of the performers put his legs behind his head and walked on his hands an old darkey sayed said he'd be d—d damned if he was human it was very poor for me

We have had two games of ball 6 or 7 loging logging frolicks mooved moved 3 barns and on the 25th we had what they called the June Hop a very fine spree but most to too grand I let myself go some I am one of the big guns out here Walt the folks know very little wich which is a letup on me
every one is trying to be my friend I should think by the way they act
No more at present but write to me as soon as you get this

postscript.p: Walter do not wate wait for me to write give my respects to all enquiring friends Dressmaker in particular and give me his address if you can
P.S. in my next I will let you know how the 4th went
